yoruba: Àkọsílẹ̀ láti ọdọ̀ Àjọ́ WHO àti Ilé-iṣẹ́ ètò ilera ilẹ̀ Syria sọ ọ́ di mímọ̀ pé méjìdínlọ́gọ́ta nìkan ni ètò iṣẹ́ rẹ̀ pé nínú ilé ìwòsàn ìjọba ọ̀kànléláàádọ́fà tí ó wà ní ilẹ̀ náà.

english: The data also noted that up to 70 percent of health workers have left the country as migrants or refugees, while the rest are often subjected to restrictions, including military and political interference.
yoruba: Àkọsílẹ̀ yìí tún fi hàn pé ó tó ìdá àádọ́rin nínú ọgọ́rùn-ún àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ elétò ìlera ilẹ̀ náà tí wọ́n ti kúrò láti di àtìpó àti ogúnléndé sí ilẹ̀ ibòmìíràn.

english: COVID-19 amid ongoing humanitarian disaster
yoruba: COVID-19 wà lára àjálù tí ó ń kujú ọmọnìyàn

english: Perhaps the biggest challenge many Syrians face is the accumulation of disasters: war, a pandemic, and famine.
yoruba: Ó ṣeéṣe kí ó jẹ́ pé ohun tí ó jẹ́ ìdojúkọ àwọn ọmọ ilẹ̀ Syria jùlọ ni bí àwọn àjálù yìí ṣe rọ́ lu ara wọn; ogun, àjàkálẹ̀-àrùn àti iyàn.

english: The United Nations warned on June 26 that Syria is now facing an "unprecedented" hunger crisis, with urgent action still needed to prevent the spread of COVID-19.
yoruba: Àjọ Ìsọkan Àgbáyé ṣe ìkìlọ̀ ní ọjọ́ kẹrìndínlọ́gbọ̀n osù Okudù pé Syria ń fojú winá ebi àpafẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́kú, ìgbẹ́sẹ̀ níkíá sì nílò láti dèènà ìtànkálẹ̀ COVID-19

english: According to the World Food Program, food prices rose by 11 percent in May compared to April, and 133 percent when compared to the same period in 2019.
yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Àjọ Elétò Ounjẹ Àgbááyé ṣe sọ, òwọ́ngọ́gọ́ bá ounjẹ pẹ̀lú ìdá mọ́kànlá iye rẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀ ní oṣù Èbìbí yàtọ̀ sí ti oṣù Igbe, ó sì wọ́n sí i ní ìwọ̀n mẹ́tàléláàádóje nígbà tí wọ́n gbé e wò sí ti ọdun 2019.

english: As the economic situation deteriorates, 28-year-old Ali al-Ahmed (also a pseudonym upon request to protect his identity) from Daraa city told Global Voices in a phone interview that "the situation is bad, regardless of how much you work, even if you make 10,000 SYP a day [between $1 and $5 USD] it will not be enough".
yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ètò ọrọ̀ ajẹ́ wọ́n ṣe dẹnukọlẹ̀. Ali al-Ahmed (orúkọkórúkọ ni èyí náà, gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹni yìí ṣe bèèrè fún ìdáàbòbò orúkọ rẹ̀) láti ìlu Daraa sọ fún Ohùn Àgbáyé ní orí ago pé "nǹkan burú jáì, kò sí irú iṣẹ́ tí o lè ṣe, kódà kí wọn ó máa san Egbẹ̀rún mẹ́wàá owó ilẹ̀ Syria (láàrin Dọ́là kan sí márùn-ún) fún ènìyàn, kò le tóó ná".

english: Ahmed said most people have been forced to forgo many basic goods due to exorbitant costs.
yoruba: Ahmed ní ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ẹrù ni àwọn ènìyàn ti kọ̀ sílẹ̀ láìgbà látàri ọ̀wọ́ngógó owó ìgbẹrù.

english: Between a health care system shattered by years of war and an economic situation that has left many Syrians impoverished, the ongoing pandemic has pushed the country toward uncharted, catastrophic territory.
yoruba: Lásìkò tí ètò ìlera wọn ti dẹnikọlẹ̀ yìí látàari ewu ogun tí ó wu wọ́n tí ètò ọ̀rọ̀ ajé tí ó forí sánpọ́n sì ti sọ ọ̀pọ̀ ọmọ ilè Syria di Akúṣẹ̀ẹ́, Àjàkálẹ̀ ààrùn tí ò jà kiri yìí tún ti ti ìlú yìí sínú ewu àìkàsí àti ìdibàjẹ́.

english: YKS, with 2.5 million students, is taking place despite all the warnings: social distancing disappeared
yoruba: Ìdánowò YKS ń lọ lọ́wọ́ pẹ̀lú mílíọ́nù méjì àbọ̀ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ládúrúu gbogbo ìkìlọ̀: Ìjìnàsíra-ẹni láwùjo gan-an di àwátì.

english: A new YKS controversy: morality
yoruba: Àìgbọ́raẹniyé Ìdànwò YKS tuntun: ìwà rere

english: COVID-19 is not the only debate surrounding YKS in 2020.
yoruba: Kì í ṣe COVID-19 nìkan ni famínfà tí ó yí Ìdánowò YKS ká ní ọdún 2020.

english: An even more impassioned discussion started in early July in relation to a text selected for the Turkish language exam.
yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ ló ti ń jà rànhìnrànhìn láti ìbẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ oṣù keje èyí tí ó nííṣe pẹ̀lú ìwé àyọkà fún ìdánwò èdè Turkish.

english: One of the questions referred to the song by pop singer Mabel Matiz, a member of the LGBTQ.
yoruba: Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ìbéèrè abẹ́ rẹ̀ tọ́ka sí “Fırtınadayım, (mo wà nínú ìjì), orin olórin tàka-n-súfèé kan Mabel Matiz ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ LGBTQ.

english: The question about the meaning of “Gözümün gördüğü, göğsümün bildiği ile bir değil” (which can be translated as “what my eyes see is not what my heart feels”) has left its mark on social media because of Mabel's popularity among young people (some of his videos have 50 million views) and his sexual orientation.
yoruba: Ìbéèrè lórí ìtumọ̀ “Gözümün gördüğü, göğsümün bildiği ile bir değil” (tí a le tú sí ohun tí ojú mi rí kọ́ ni ohun tí aya mí mọ̀) ti ń da àwọn ìkànnì àwùjọ rú gùdùgùdù nítorí Mabel jẹ́ ẹni tí àwọn ọdọ́ mọ̀ bí ẹni mọ owó (Ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn fọ́nrán rẹ̀ ní ó máa ń ní olùwò tí ó tó àádọ́ta mílíọ́nù) àti ìṣe rẹ̀ lórí àwọn ohun tí ó jẹmọ́ akọ àti abo.

english: Following growing debates on Twitter, Halis Aygün, the president of the Center for Measurement, Selection and Placement (ÖSYM), the government body responsible for preparing the exam, gave an interview to far-right conservative media Yeni Akit in which he said the matter would be investigated and that those responsible for including the text would be fired:
yoruba: Ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú fàmínfà orí ìkànni Twitter, Halis Aygün Ààrẹ Center for Measurement, Selection and Placement (ÖSYM), ẹ̀ka ìjọba tí ó bójú tó ìṣètò ìdánwò sọ nínú ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwọ̀ pẹ̀lú àgbà òṣìṣẹ́ ìròyìn kan, Yeni Akit. Níbẹ̀ ni ó ti sọ pé wọn yóò ṣe ìwádìí ọ̀rọ̀ náà, gbogbo àwọn tí wọ́n bá sì lọ́wọ́ nínú fífi ìwé náà si abẹ́ ìdánwò ọ̀hún ni wọ́n yóò lé kúrò lẹ́nu iṣẹ́.

english: The 2020 YKS was completed safely and successfully in 188 exam centers in three sessions with the participation of approximately two and a half million candidates.
yoruba: Ìdánwò YKS ọdún 2020 kẹ́sẹ járí kákàkiri àwọn ibùdó ìdánwò méjìdínnígbà (188) ní ìṣí ẹ̀ẹ̀mẹta, tí àwọn akópa nínú rẹ̀ sì ń lọ bíi mílíọ́nù méjì àbọ̀.

english: The question pool is created with the participation of thousands of academicians from different universities of our country.
yoruba: Àwọn ìdánwò rẹ̀ jẹ́ èyí tí àwọn onímọ̀ akadá káàkiri àwọn fáfitì orílẹ̀-èdè wa ṣètò.

english: The sensitivity of the management of our institution about our national, moral values and social value judgments is clear.
yoruba: Ìkíyèsí àwọn ẹ̀kọ́ ilé àti ọgbọ́n ìbágbépò láwùjọ fùn àwọn ilé-ìwé gíga wa máa ń jẹ́ kíkíyèsí.

english: An investigation has been launched into the content of the relevant question in the Turkish area of the 2020 YKS's TYT [this refers to one portion of the YKS exam] session.
yoruba: Wọ́n ti fi ìdí ìwádìí lọ́lẹ̀ lórí àkóónú àwọn ìbéèrè tí ó nííṣe pẹ̀lú ìdánwò èdè Turkish ti ìdánwò YKS ọdún 2020 [èyí ká ọ̀kan nínú àwọn abala ìdánwò YKS].

english: The members of staff responsible will be discharged from the process of question preparation.
yoruba: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ tí èyí bá ṣí mọ́ lórí ni wọn yóò di gbígbọ́n dànù kúrò nínú ìṣètò ìdánwò.

english: For some Twitter users, those measures aren't enough:
yoruba: Fún àwọn asàmúlò ìkànnì Twitter kan, ìdájọ́ yìí kò tó:

english: [Top] ÖSYM President spoke for the first time after the exam!
yoruba: [Òkè] Ààrẹ ÖSYM sọ̀rọ̀ fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ lẹ́yìn ìdánwò! “

english: “An investigation has been launched into the content of the problem.
yoruba: Wọ́n ti fi ìdí ìwádìí lọ́lẹ̀ láti wo ibi tí ìṣòro náà ti wọ́wá.

english: Responsible persons will be removed from the question preparation processes. “
yoruba: Àwọn tí wọ́n bá lọ́wọ́ nínú rẹ̀ yóò di gbígbọ́n dànù kúrò nínú ìṣètò ìdánwò.”

english: [Bottom] It is not enough [to remove him], the neglecting president must be removed from the management process so that he is properly done with.
yoruba: [Ìsàlẹ̀] Kò tó [lá ti yọ ọ́] nìkan, Ààrẹ tí kò ka nǹkan sí náà gbọdọ̀ jẹ́ yíyọ kúrò nínú ìṣàkósọ gbogbo kí ojú rẹ̀ le wálẹ̀.

english: Conservative segments of society also question the intention behind the choice of that question:
yoruba: Ọ̀wọ́ àwọn alẹ́nulọ́rọ̀ láwùjọ náà tún rí wí sí ìpinnu àti ṣètò irú ìbéèrè báyìí:

english: In today's YKS2020 exam, couldn't you find anyone else to show to teenagers other than the gay and LGBT advocate Mabel Matiz?
yoruba: Nínú ìdánwò YKS2020 tí ó wáyé lónìí, ẹ kò rí ẹlòmìíràn fi ṣe àpèjúwe fún àwọn ọmọdé wọ̀nyí àfi ọkùnrin oníbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ nnì Mabel Matiz

english: (The one who carries a banner saying “we are faggots”) What are you trying to do?
yoruba: (Ènìyàn tí ó gbé àkólé tí ó fi ń polongo pé “Oníbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ ni àwa” Kí ni ẹ̀ ń gbìyànjú láti ṣe?

english: Public opinion remains largely divided as other Twitter users point out the success and popularity of Mabel Matiz:
yoruba: Èrò àwọn aṣàmúlò ìkànni Twitter kò ṣọ̀kan pẹ̀lú bí àwọn mìíràn ṣe ń tọ́ka sí àwọn àṣeyọrí Mabel Matiz àti bí ó ṣe lókìkí sí:

english: Dear investigative board members, I recommend that you watch Mabel Matiz's clips. Because we have no other artists who have embraced our culture this way for many years. That's why mabelmatiz is the treasure of our land. He is a unique “artist”
yoruba: Èyin ọmọ ìgbìmọ̀ aṣèwádìí. Mo fẹ́ kí ẹ wo àwọn fọ́nrán Mabel Matiz. Nítorí pé a kò ní eléré mìíràn tí ó ti ṣe àmúlò àṣà wa tó báyìí ní ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún sẹ́yìn. Ìdí nìyẹn tí mabelmatiz ṣe jẹ́ ìsúra wa.

english: This netizen draws attention to the fact that by focusing on a gay singer politicians avoid addressing real issues:
yoruba: Àwọn netizen pé àkíyèsí sí i pé fífi ojú sun olórin tí ó jẹ́ oníbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ, àwọn olóṣèlú yóò pa àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ tí ó ṣe kókó tì:

english: Nobody makes any noise about rapists, yet Mabel Matiz question becomes the subject of an investigation.
yoruba: Kò sí ẹni tí ó figbe ta lórí àwọn afipábánilòpọ̀, síbẹ̀ ìwádìí Mabel Matiz ni wọ́n ń gbà bí ẹni ń gba igbá ọtí.

english: You say “our social value judgments” but Mabel Matiz is the best reflector of our culture.
yoruba: Ẹ sọ pé “ìdààbò bo ìṣe wa” ṣùgbọ́n Mabel Matiz ni ẹni tí ó ṣe ìgbéjáde àṣà wa jùlọ.

english: Thus investigation should be about the ones who insult Mabel Matiz and discriminate against him.
yoruba: Ó wa yẹ kí ìwádìí ó dá lé àwọn èyí tí ó tàbùkù Mabel Matiz tí wọ́n sì ṣẹlẹ́yàmẹ́yá rẹ̀.

english: Mabel Matiz's response to the controversy.
yoruba: Èsì Mabel Matiz sí àìgbọ́raẹniyé náà.

english: On July 3, as the debate became more heated, Matiz finally broke his silence:
yoruba: Ní ọjọ́ kẹta oṣù keje, bí fàmínfà náà ṣe ń gbóná sí i, Matiz padà la ohùn:

english: Hi:) I was very happy that my music was be the subject of such an important exam.
yoruba: Ẹ ǹlẹ́ o:) Inú mi dùn pé orin mi jẹ́ lílò fún irú ìdánwò pàtàkì bí èyí.

english: Now I am amazed at how my personal values are subject of the same exam.
yoruba: Ní báyìí, ìyàlẹ́nu lójẹ́ fún mi bí ìgbéayé mi ṣe di ohun tí ó kan ìdánwò tí à ń sọ yìí.

english: Look what I was tested with, while the geographical sign logo was about placed next to my name.
yoruba: Ẹ wo ohun tí a fi dán mi wò..bí a ṣe gbé ààmi kan ní ìfẹ̀gbẹ́kẹ̀gbẹ́ pẹ̀lú orúkọ mi.

english: Well, I say that life's exams never end :) Another roll call came from here.
yoruba: Kò burú, Ìdánwò ayé kò lópin:) Iyán tún di àtúngún wàyí.

english: I read your intense messages of support.
yoruba: Mo ka ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn àtẹjáde tí ó ṣègbè lẹ́yín mi.

english: I understand what I want to say with my music, I sense that you understand me, and I feel even stronger now.
yoruba: Òhun tí mo fẹ́ sọ nínú orin yẹn yémi, mó nímọ̀ pé ó yé ẹ̀yin náà, ara mi sì tún yá gágá sí i.

english: I will continue to make my music, tell stories, and be part of this country.
yoruba: N ó tẹ̀síwájú láti máa kọ orin sí i, láti máa sọ ìtàn àti láti jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè yìí.

english: See you in another exam…
yoruba: Ká tún pàdé nínú ìdánwò mìíràn…

english: Matiz remains very popular: Just one day after Aygun's statement.
yoruba: Matiz sì lókìkí síbẹ̀: lẹ́yìn ọjọ́ kan tí Aygun sọ̀rọ̀ sáfẹ́fẹ́.

english: He received two awards in a competition based on the popular vote.
yoruba: Ó gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ méjì nínú ìdíje àmì-ẹ̀yẹ kan nípasẹ̀ ìbò tí ó pọ̀jù.

english: He won in two categories.
yoruba: Ó gba àmì-ẹyẹ ipele méjì.

english: “Best Clip” and “Best Male Singer” at the 46th Pantene Golden Butterfly Awards.
yoruba: “Orin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ” àti “Olórin ọkùnrin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ” ní ìdíje àmìẹyẹ Pantene Golden Butterfly ẹlẹ́ẹ̀kẹrìndínláàádọ́ta irú rẹ̀.

english: This seems to indicate that very large numbers of people support him against the homophobia expressed by the government and conservative citizens.
yoruba: Èyí fi hàn pé ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyá̀n ni wọ́n wà lẹ́yìn rẹ tako ọ̀rọ̀ ìbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ tí ìjọba àti àwọn alẹ́nulọ́rọ̀ tí ìjọba ń sọ.

english: On July 5, Mabel Matiz tweeted again:
yoruba: Ní ọjọ́ karùn oṣù keje, Mabel Matix tún túwíìtì:

english: I received the “Best Male Artist” and “Best Video Clip” awards at the 46th Golden Butterfly Awards, I am happy!
yoruba: Mo gba àmì-ẹyẹ “Fọ́nrán orin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ” àti “Olórin ọkùnrin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ” nínú ìdíje àmì-ẹyẹ Pantene Golden Butterfly ẹlẹ́ẹ̀kẹrìndínláàádọ́ta irú rẹ̀

english: Thanks to all my dear listeners! I would like to extend my thanks to Erhan Arık and DOP Meryem Yavuz, the precious directors of [my song] “I Have a Red in My Wipe” clip.
yoruba: . Inú mi dùn! Ẹ ṣé gan ẹ̀yin olùgbọ́ mi gbogbo. Màá fẹ́ láti dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Erhan Arik àti DOP Meryem Yavuz. Àwọn tí wọ́n darí fọ́nrán [orin mi] “I Have a Red in My Wipe” tẹ́lẹ̀.

english: In Turkey, 2.5m students sit university entry exam despite COVID-19 outbreak
yoruba: Ní orílẹ̀-èdè Turkey, ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún méjì àbọ̀ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ni wọ́n jókòó ṣe ìdánwò ìgbaniwọlẹ́ sí Ifásitì

english: This year's exam was embroiled in controversy—and not just because of the pandemic
yoruba: Ìdánwò ọdún yìí wáyé nínú àìgbọ́raẹniyé—àti pé kì í ṣe nítorí àjàkálẹ̀

english: Posted 17 July 2020 12:54 GMT
yoruba: Àtẹ̀jáde ìtúmọ̀ 15 Ògún 2020 8:07 GMT

english: Screenshot of the YouTube video featuring a song by Mabel Matiz including the lyrics at the heart of the current controversy around the Higher Education Institutions Exam (YKS):
yoruba: Àwòrán ojú ìwò àwòrán-olóhùn orí YouTube ti orin kan láti ọwọ́ Mabel Matiz pẹ̀lú ọ̀rọ̀ orin náà ní àárín àìgbọ́raẹniyé tí ó súyọ látàrí Ìdánwò Ìgbaniwọlé sí Ilé Ẹ̀kọ́ Gíga (YKS):

english: "Gözümün gördüğü, göğsümün bildiği ile bir değil" ("what my eyes see is not what my heart feels")
yoruba: "Gözümün gördüğü, göğsümün bildiği ile bir değil" (ohun tí ojú mi rí kọ́ ni ọkàn mi mọ̀ ")

english: In Turkey, a country of over 83 million people, one needs to pass an entry test, the Higher Education Institution Exam, called Yükseköğretim Kurumları Sınavı in Turkish (YKS) to enter university.
yoruba: Ní orílẹ̀-èdè Turkey, orílẹ̀-èdè tí ó lé ní ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́tàlélọ́gọ́rin ènìyàn (83 million), ènìyàn ní láti peregedé nínú ìdánwò ìgbaniwọlé tí wọn ń pè ní Yükseköğretim Kurumları Sınavı ní èdè ilẹ̀ Turkey láti wọlé sí Fáfitì.

english: This year, the multiple-choice questionnaire was taken in physical spaces by 2.5 million people, despite the COVID-19 pandemic.
yoruba: Pẹ̀lú bí àjàkẹ́lẹ̀ COVID-19 ṣe ń jà rànhìn rànhìn, ìdánwò yìí sì jẹ́ ṣíṣe lójútáyé, ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún méjì àbọ̀ ènìyàn (2.5 million) ni wọ́n jókòó ṣe ìdánwò náà.

english: On March 26, the Council of Higher Education announced the dates for YKS as July 25-26.
yoruba: Ní ọjọ́ 26 osù Kẹta, àjọ àwọn ilé-ìwé gíga ilẹ̀ náà kéde ọjọ́ ìdánwò YKS yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bi ọjọ́ 25 sí ọjọ́ 26 oṣù Keje.

english: On May 4, Turkish President Recep Erdoğan changed them to June 27 and 28.
yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n ní ọjọ́ 4 oṣù karùn-ún, Ààrẹ ilẹ̀ Turkey Recep Erdoğan yí ọjọ́ náà sí ọjọ́ 27 sí ọjọ́ 28 oṣù Keje.

english: The changes and the uncertainties around the exam amid the COVID-19 pandemic launched countless discussions in Turkish society and on social media:
yoruba: Àyípadà yìí àti àìdájú ìdánwò yìí ti ń kọ àwọn ènìyàn ilẹ̀ Turkey lóminú, ní ààrín ìgboro ìlú àti ní orí àwọn èrọ alátagbà lórí pé:

english: How do date changes affect the psychology of students, given the level of stress associated to YKS for which candidates prepare for months?
yoruba: Báwo ni ọjọ́ yíyí ṣe ní ipá lórí ìrònú àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tí wọn ń múra sílẹ̀ de ìdánwò láti bí osù mélòó kan?

english: How would COVID-19 prevention measures be applied and respected (social distancing, temperature measurements, the use of masks) when bringing together 2.5 million people?
yoruba: Báwo ni àwọn àlàkalẹ̀ àti òfi ìdèènà ìtànkálẹ̀ COVID-19 yóò ṣe di títẹ̀lé (Jíjìnnà síra ẹni láwùjọ, ìwọn ìgbọ́nà/tutù, ìlò ạṣọ ìbomú) bí a bá ń kó ènìyàn tí ó tó mílíọ́nù méjì àbọ̀ papọ̀.

english: In 2019, 74.16 percent of the candidates passed the first part of YKS, and only 39.4 percent succeeded in the second part of the exam.
yoruba: Ní ọdún 2019, ìdá mẹ́rìnléláàádọ́rin ó lé díẹ̀ ni àwọn olùṣèdánwò tí wọ́n pegedé nínú ìdánwò náà, nígbà tí ìdá mọ́kàndínlógójì pegedé sí ìpele ìkejì ìdánwò náà.

english: Turkey registered its first confirmed COVID-19 case on March 11, and by July 15, around 5,500 people infected with the virus have died, while there have been more than 200,000 confirmed cases of the disease in the country.
yoruba: Orílẹ̀-èdè Turkey ṣe àkọsílẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ COVID-19 àkọ́kọ́ wọn ní ọjọ́ 11 oṣù kẹta ọdún, ní ìgbà tí ó fi máa di ọjọ́ 15 oṣù keje ẹ̀nìyàn ẹgbẹ̀rún márùn-ún àbọ̀ ti pàdánù ẹ̀mí wọn sí ọwọ́ ààrùn náà bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni iye ènìyàn tí ó ti ní ààrùn náà ti lé ní igba ẹgbèrún.

english: On July 1, the government enforced special normalization measures:
yoruba: Ní ọjọ́ 1 oṣù keje, Ìjọba gùnlé àwọn ìgbéṣẹ̀ ìdẹ́kun lóríṣiríṣi:

english: Businesses such as restaurants, cafes, cinemas and wedding halls that had been closed for about three months reopened with social distancing restrictions.
yoruba: Àwọn ilé oko-òwò bi ilé ounjẹ, àwọn oko òwò ẹ̀rọ ayélujára, ilé ìṣàfihàn eré, gbọ̀ngàn ạyẹyẹ ìgbeyàwó tí wọ́n tì pa fún bíi oṣù mẹ́ta ni wọ́n ti tún ṣí padà báyìí, àmọ́ ṣá pẹ̀lú àtẹ̀lé ìjíjìnà síra ẹni láwùjọ.

english: Patrons are now required to wear masks and will have their temperature taken as well.
yoruba: Àwọn olùbẹ̀wò báyìí nílò láti máa bo imú wọ, wọn yóò sì máa ṣe àyẹ̀wò ìgbóná/tutù wọn.

english: While students and opposition parties called for a further postponement of the YKS, the government went ahead with its plans:
yoruba: Bí àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ tilẹ̀ fi ìpè síta pé kí ìdánwò YKS ó di sísún síwájú, ìjọba ò tẹ̀tì nínú àlàkalẹ̀ rẹ̀:

english: In late June, 2.5 million people took the exam.
yoruba: Ní ìparí oṣù keje mílíọ̀nù méjì àbọ̀ ni ó jókòó ṣe ìdánwò náà..

english: As can be seen in this tweet, concerns over enforcement of social distancing in this context proved to be legitimate:
yoruba: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí a ṣe rí i ní inú túwíìtì yìí, tí ó nííṣe pẹ̀lú àsujù lórí ìmúnitẹ̀lẹ́ ìjìnnà sí ara ẹni láwùjọ:

english: YKS, with 2.5 million students, is taking place despite all the warnings: social distancing disappeared
yoruba: Ìdánowò YKS ń lọ lọ́wọ́ pẹ̀lú mílíọ́nù méjì àbọ̀ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ládúrúu gbogbo ìkìlọ̀: Ìjìnàsíra-ẹni láwùjo gan-an di àwátì.

english: A new YKS controversy: morality
yoruba: Àìgbọ́raẹniyé Ìdànwò YKS tuntun: ìwà rere

english: COVID-19 is not the only debate surrounding YKS in 2020.
yoruba: Kì í ṣe COVID-19 nìkan ni famínfà tí ó yí Ìdánowò YKS ká ní ọdún 2020.

english: An even more impassioned discussion started in early July in relation to a text selected for the Turkish language exam.
yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ ló ti ń jà rànhìnrànhìn láti ìbẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ oṣù keje èyí tí ó nííṣe pẹ̀lú ìwé àyọkà fún ìdánwò èdè Turkish.

english: One of the questions referred to the song by pop singer Mabel Matiz, a member of the LGBTQ+ community, “Fırtınadayım” (“I am in the storm”):
yoruba: Ọ̀kan nínú àwọn ìbéèrè abẹ́ rẹ̀ tọ́ka sí “Fırtınadayım, (mo wà nínú ìjì), orin olórin tàka-n-súfèé kan Mabel Matiz tí í ṣe LGBTQ “Fırtınadayım” (“I am in the storm”):

english: The question about the meaning of “Gözümün gördüğü, göğsümün bildiği ile bir değil” (which can be translated as “what my eyes see is not what my heart feels”) has left its mark on social media because of Mabel's popularity among young people (some of his videos have 50 million views) and his sexual orientation.
yoruba: Ìbéèrè lórí ìtumọ̀ “Gözümün gördüğü, göğsümün bildiği ile bir değil” (tí a le tú sí ohun tí ojú mi rí kọ́ ni ohun tí aya mí mọ̀) ti ń da àwọn ìkànnì àwùjọ rú gùdùgùdù nítorí Mabel jẹ́ ẹni tí àwọn ọdọ́ mọ̀ bí ẹni mọ owó (ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn àwòrán-àtohùn rẹ̀ ní ó máa ń ní ìwò tí ó tó àádọ́ta mílíọ́nù) àti ìṣe rẹ̀ lórí àwọn ohun tí ó jẹmọ́ akọ́ṣebíabo.

english: Following growing debates on Twitter, Halis Aygün, the president of the Center for Measurement, Selection and Placement (ÖSYM), the government body responsible for preparing the exam, gave an interview to far-right conservative media Yeni Akit.
yoruba: Ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú fàmínfà orí ìkànni Twitter, Halis Aygün Ààrẹ Center for Measurement, Selection and Placement (ÖSYM), ẹ̀ka ìjọba tí ó bójú tó ìṣètò ìdánwò sọ nínú ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwọ̀ pẹ̀lú àgbà òṣìṣẹ́ ìròyìn kan, Yeni Akit.

english: In which he said the matter would be investigated and that those responsible for including the text would be fired:
yoruba: Níbẹ̀ ni ó ti sọ pé wọn yóò ṣe ìwádìí ọ̀rọ̀ náà, gbogbo àwọn tí wọ́n bá sì lọ́wọ́ nínú fífi ìwé náà si abẹ́ ìdánwò ọ̀hún ni wọ́n yóò lé kúrò lẹ́nu iṣẹ́:

english: The 2020 YKS was completed safely and successfully in 188 exam centers in three sessions with the participation of approximately two and a half million candidates.
yoruba: Ìdánwò YKS ọdún 2020 kẹ́sẹ járí kákàkiri àwọn ibùdó ìdánwò méjìdínnígbà (188) ní ìṣí ẹ̀ẹ̀mẹta, tí àwọn akópa nínú rẹ̀ sì ń lọ bíi mílíọ́nù méjì àbọ̀.

english: The question pool is created with the participation of thousands of academicians from different universities of our country.
yoruba: Àwọn ìdánwò rẹ̀ jẹ́ èyí tí àwọn onímọ̀ akadá káàkiri àwọn fáfitì orílẹ̀-èdè wa ṣètò.

english: The sensitivity of the management of our institution about our national, moral values and social value judgments is clear.
yoruba: Ìkíyèsí àwọn ẹ̀kọ́ ilé àti ọgbọ́n ìbágbépò láwùjọ fùn àwọn ilé-ìwé gíga wa máa ń jẹ́ kíkíyèsí.

english: The members of staff responsible will be discharged from the process of question preparation.
yoruba: Àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ tí èyí bá ṣí mọ́ lórí ni wọn yóò di gbígbọ́n dànù kúrò nínú ìṣètò ìdánwò.

english: For some Twitter users, those measures aren't enough:
yoruba: Fún àwọn asàmúlò ìkànnì Twitter kan, ìdájọ́ yìí kò tó:

english: [Top]  ÖSYM President spoke for the first time after the exam!
yoruba: [Òkè] Ààrẹ ÖSYM sọ̀rọ̀ fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ lẹ́yìn ìdánwò!

english: "An investigation has been launched into the content of the problem. Responsible persons will be removed from the question preparation processes. "
yoruba: "Wọ́n ti fi ìdí ìwádìí lọ́lẹ̀ láti wo ibi tí ìṣòro náà ti wọ́wá. Àwọn tí wọ́n bá lọ́wọ́ nínú rẹ̀ yóò di gbígbọ́n dànù kúrò nínú ìṣètò ìdánwò."

english: [Bottom] It is not enough [to remove him], the neglecting president must be removed from the management process so that he is properly done with.
yoruba: [Ìsàlẹ̀] Kò tó [lá ti yọ ọ́] nìkan, Ààrẹ tí kò ka nǹkan sí náà gbọdọ̀ jẹ́ yíyọ kúrò nínú ìṣàkósọ gbogbo kí ojú rẹ̀ le wálẹ̀.

english: Conservative segments of society also question the intention behind the choice of that question:
yoruba: Ọ̀wọ́ àwọn alẹ́nulọ́rọ̀ láwùjọ náà tún rí wí sí ìpinnu àti ṣètò irú ìbéèrè báyìí:

english: In today's #YKS2020 exam, couldn't you find anyone else to show to teenagers other than the gay and LGBT advocate Mabel Matiz?
yoruba: Nínú ìdánwò #YKS2020 tí ó wáyé lónìí, ẹ kò rí ẹlòmìíràn fi ṣe àpèjúwe fún àwọn ọmọdé wọ̀nyí àfi ọkùnrin oníbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ nnì Mabel Matiz?

english: (The one who carries a banner saying "we are faggots")
yoruba: (Ènìyàn tí ó gbé àkólé tí ó fi ń polongo pé "Oníbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ ni àwa"

english: What are you trying to do?
yoruba: Kí ni ẹ̀ ń gbìyànjú láti ṣe?

english: Public opinion remains largely divided as other Twitter users point out the success and popularity of Mabel Matiz:
yoruba: Èrò àwọn aṣàmúlò ìkànni Twitter kò ṣọ̀kan pẹ̀lú bí àwọn mìíràn ṣe ń tọ́ka sí àwọn àṣeyọrí Mabel Matiz àti bí ó ṣe lókìkí sí:

english: Dear investigative board members, I recommend that you watch Mabel Matiz's clips.
yoruba: Èyin ọmọ ìgbìmọ̀ aṣèwádìí. Mo fẹ́ kí ẹ wo àwọn fọ́nrán Mabel Matiz.

english: Because we have no other artists who have embraced our culture this way for many years.
yoruba: Nítorí pé a kò ní eléré mìíràn tí ó ti ṣe àmúlò àṣà wa tó báyìí ní ọ̀pọ̀ ọdún sẹ́yìn.

english: That's why #mabelmatiz is the treasure of our land. He is a unique “artist”
yoruba: Ìdí nìyẹn tí mabelmatiz ṣe jẹ́ ìsúra wa.

english: This netizen draws attention to the fact that by focusing on a gay singer politicians avoid addressing real issues:
yoruba: Àwọn èèyàn lórí ayélujára pé àkíyèsí sí i pé fífi ojú sun olórin tí ó jẹ́ oníbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ, àwọn olóṣèlú yóò pa àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ tí ó ṣe kókó tì:

english: Nobody makes any noise about rapists, yet Mabel Matiz question becomes the subject of an investigation.
yoruba: Kò sí ẹni tí ó figbe ta lórí àwọn afipábánilòpọ̀, síbẹ̀ ìwádìí Mabel Matiz ni wọ́n ń gbà bí ẹni ń gba igbá ọtí.

english: And this one concludes:
yoruba: Eléyìí kó gbogbo rẹ̀ nílẹ̀:

english: You say “our social value judgments” but Mabel Matiz is the best reflector of our culture.
yoruba: Ẹ sọ pé "ìdààbò bo ìṣe wa" ṣùgbọ́n Mabel Matiz ni ẹni tí ó ṣe ìgbéjáde àṣà wa jùlọ.

english: Thus investigation should be about the ones who insult Mabel Matiz and discriminate against him. #MabelMatizisnotalone [Top of post]
yoruba: Ó wa yẹ kí ìwádìí ó dá lé àwọn èyí tí ó tàbùkù Mabel Matiz tí wọ́n sì ṣẹlẹ́yàmẹ́yá rẹ̀. #MabelMatizisnotalone [Àtẹ̀jáde òkè]

english: Mabel Matiz's response to the controversy
yoruba: Èsì Mabel Matiz sí àìgbọ́raẹniyé náà

english: On July 3, as the debate became more heated, Matiz finally broke his silence:
yoruba: Ní ọjọ́ 3 oṣù Keje, bí fàmínfà náà ṣe ń gbóná sí i, Matiz padà la ohùn:

english: Hi:) I was very happy that my music was be the subject of such an important exam.
yoruba: Ẹ ǹlẹ́ o:) Inú mi dùn pé orin mi jẹ́ lílò fún irú ìdánwò pàtàkì bí èyí.

english: Now I am amazed at how my personal values are subject of the same exam.
yoruba: Ní báyìí, ìyàlẹ́nu lójẹ́ fún mi bí ìgbéayé mi ṣe di ohun tí ó kan ìdánwò tí à ń sọ yìí.

english: Look what I was tested with, while the geographical sign logo was about placed next to my name.
yoruba: Ẹ wo ohun tí a fi dán mi wò..bí a ṣe gbé ààmi kan ní ìfẹ̀gbẹ́kẹ̀gbẹ́ pẹ̀lú orúkọ mi.

english: Well, I say that life's exams never end :)
yoruba: Kò burú, Ìdánwò ayé kò lópin:)

english: Another roll call came from here.
yoruba: Iyán tún di àtúngún wàyí.

english: I read your intense messages of support.
yoruba: Mo ka ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn àtẹjáde tí ó ṣègbè lẹ́yín mi.

english: I understand what I want to say with my music, I sense that you understand me, and I feel even stronger now.
yoruba: Òhun tí mo fẹ́ sọ nínú orin yẹn yémi, mó nímọ̀ pé ó yé ẹ̀yin náà, ara mi sì tún yá gágá sí i.

english: I will continue to make my music, tell stories, and be part of this country.
yoruba: N ó tẹ̀síwájú láti máa kọ orin sí i, láti máa sọ ìtàn àti láti jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè yìí.

english: See you in another exam...
yoruba: Ká tún pàdé nínú ìdánwò mìíràn...

english: Matiz remains very popular: Just one day after Aygun's statement, he received two awards in a competition based on the popular vote.
yoruba: Matiz sì lókìkí síbẹ̀: lẹ́yìn ọjọ́ kan tí Aygun sọ̀rọ̀ sáfẹ́fẹ́, ó gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ méjì nínú ìdíje àmì-ẹ̀yẹ kan nípasẹ̀ ìbò tí ó pọ̀jù.

english: He won in two categories, “Best Clip” and “Best Male Singer” at the 46th Pantene Golden Butterfly Awards.
yoruba: Ó gba àmì-ẹyẹ ipele méjì, “Orin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ” àti “Olórin ọkùnrin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ” ní ìdíje àmìẹyẹ Pantene Golden Butterfly ẹlẹ́ẹ̀kẹrìndínláàádọ́ta irú rẹ̀.

english: This seems to indicate that very large numbers of people support him against the homophobia expressed by the government and conservative citizens.
yoruba: Èyí fi hàn pé ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyá̀n ni wọ́n wà lẹ́yìn rẹ tako ọ̀rọ̀ ìbálòpọ̀-akọsíakọ tí ìjọba àti àwọn alẹ́nulọ́rọ̀ tí ìjọba ń sọ.

english: On July 5, Mabel Matiz tweeted again:
yoruba: Ní ọjọ́ 5 oṣù Keje, Mabel Matix tún túwíìtì:

english: I received the “Best Male Artist” and “Best Video Clip” awards at the 46th Golden Butterfly Awards, I am happy!
yoruba: Mo gba àmì-ẹyẹ "àwòrán-àtohùn orin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ" àti “Olórin ọkùnrin tí mùṣèmúṣè rẹ̀ dá múṣé jùlọ” nínú ìdíje àmì-ẹyẹ Pantene Golden Butterfly ẹlẹ́ẹ̀kẹrìndínláàádọ́ta irú rẹ̀, Inú mi dùn!

english: Thanks to all my dear listeners!
yoruba: Ẹ ṣé gan ẹ̀yin olùgbọ́ mi gbogbo.

english: I would like to extend my thanks to Erhan Arık and DOP Meryem Yavuz, the precious directors of [my song]
yoruba: Màá fẹ́ láti dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Erhan Arik àti DOP Meryem Yavuz, àwọn tí wọ́n darí àwòrán-àtohùn [orin mi]

english: "I Have a Red in My Wipe" clip.
yoruba: "I Have a Red in My Wipe" clip tẹ́lẹ̀.
